00025 /*! \file psht.h
00026  *  Interface for the spherical transform library.
00027  *
00028  *  Copyright (C) 2006-2011 Max-Planck-Society
00029  *  \author Martin Reinecke
00030  */
00031 
00032 #ifndef PLANCK_PSHT_H
00033 #define PLANCK_PSHT_H
00034 
00035 #include <stddef.h>
00036 #include "sse_utils.h"
00037 
00038 #ifdef __cplusplus
00039 extern "C" {
00040 #endif
00041 
00042 /*! PSHT type for storing single-precision complex values */
00043 typedef struct
00044   {
00045   float re,im;
00046   } pshts_cmplx;
00047 
00048 /*! PSHT type for storing double-precision complex values */
00049 typedef struct
00050   {
00051   double re,im;
00052   } pshtd_cmplx;
00053 
00054 extern const pshts_cmplx pshts_cmplx_null;
00055 extern const pshtd_cmplx pshtd_cmplx_null;
00056 
00057 /*! Helper type containing information about a single ring.
00058     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00059 typedef struct
00060   {
00061   double theta, phi0, weight, cth, sth;
00062   ptrdiff_t ofs;
00063   int nph, stride;
00064   } psht_ringinfo;
00065 
00066 /*! Helper type containing information about a pair of rings with colatitudes
00067     symmetric around the equator.
00068     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00069 typedef struct
00070   {
00071   psht_ringinfo r1,r2;
00072   } psht_ringpair;
00073 
00074 /*! Enumeration of PSHT job types.
00075     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00076 typedef enum { MAP2ALM, ALM2MAP, ALM2MAP_DERIV1 } psht_jobtype;
00077 
00078 /*! Type holding all required information about a map geometry.
00079     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00080 typedef struct
00081   {
00082   psht_ringpair *pair;
00083   int npairs;
00084   } psht_geom_info;
00085 
00086 /*! Type holding all required information about a double precision SHT.
00087     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00088 typedef struct
00089   {
00090   psht_jobtype type;
00091   int spin;
00092   int add_output;
00093   int nmaps, nalm;
00094   double *map[3];
00095   pshtd_cmplx *alm[3];
00096   pshtd_cmplx *phas1[3], *phas2[3];
00097   double *norm_l;
00098   union {
00099 #ifdef __SSE2__
00100     v2df *v[3];
00101     v2df2 *v2[3];
00102 #else
00103     pshtd_cmplx *c[3];
00104 #endif
00105     } alm_tmp;
00106   } pshtd_job;
00107 
00108 enum { psht_maxjobs=10 };
00109 
00110 /*! Type holding a list of simultaneous double precision SHT jobs.
00111     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00112 typedef struct
00113   {
00114   pshtd_job job[psht_maxjobs];
00115   int njobs;
00116   } pshtd_joblist;
00117 
00118 /*! Type holding all required information about a single precision SHT.
00119     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00120 typedef struct
00121   {
00122   psht_jobtype type;
00123   int spin;
00124   int add_output;
00125   int nmaps, nalm;
00126   float *map[3];
00127   pshts_cmplx *alm[3];
00128   pshtd_cmplx *phas1[3], *phas2[3];
00129   double *norm_l;
00130   union {
00131 #ifdef __SSE2__
00132     v2df *v[3];
00133     v2df2 *v2[3];
00134 #else
00135     pshtd_cmplx *c[3];
00136 #endif
00137     } alm_tmp;
00138   } pshts_job;
00139 
00140 /*! Type holding a list of simultaneous single precision SHT jobs.
00141     \note No user serviceable parts inside! */
00142 typedef struct
00143   {
00144   pshts_job job[psht_maxjobs];
00145   int njobs;
00146   } pshts_joblist;
00147 
00148 /*! \defgroup almgroup Helpers for calculation of a_lm indices */
00149 /*! \{ */
00150 
00151 /*! Helper type for index calculation in a_lm arrays. */
00152 typedef struct
00153   {
00154   /*! Maximum \a l index of the array */
00155   int lmax;
00156   /*! Number of different \a m values in this object */
00157   int nm;
00158   /*! Array with \a nm entries containing the individual m values */
00159   int *mval;
00160   /*! Array with \a nm entries containing the (hypothetical) indices of
00161       the coefficients with quantum numbers 0,\a mval[i] */
00162   ptrdiff_t *mvstart;
00163   /*! Stride between a_lm and a_(l+1),m */
00164   ptrdiff_t stride;
00165   } psht_alm_info;
00166 
00167 /*! Creates an Alm data structure information from the following parameters:
00168     \param lmax maximum \a l quantum number (>=0)
00169     \param mmax maximum \a m quantum number (0<= \a mmax <= \a lmax)
00170     \param stride the stride between consecutive a_lm entries
00171     \param mstart the index of the (hypothetical) coefficient with the
00172       quantum numbers 0,\a m. Must have \a mmax+1 entries.
00173     \param alm_info will hold a pointer to the newly created data structure
00174  */
00175 void psht_make_alm_info (int lmax, int mmax, int stride,
00176   const ptrdiff_t *mstart, psht_alm_info **alm_info);
00177 /*! Creates an Alm data structure information from the following parameters:
00178     \param lmax maximum \a l quantum number (>=0)
00179     \param nm number of different \a m (<=\a lmax+1)
00180     \param stride the stride between consecutive a_lm entries
00181     \param mval array with \a nm entries containing the individual m values
00182     \param mvstart array with \a nm entries containing the (hypothetical)
00183       indices of the coefficients with the quantum numbers 0,\a mval[i]
00184     \param alm_info will hold a pointer to the newly created data structure
00185  */
00186 void psht_make_general_alm_info (int lmax, int nm, int stride, const int *mval,
00187   const ptrdiff_t *mvstart, psht_alm_info **alm_info);
00188 /*! Returns the index of the coefficient with quantum numbers \a l,
00189     \a mval[mi]. */
00190 ptrdiff_t psht_alm_index (const psht_alm_info *self, int l, int mi);
00191 /*! Deallocates the a_lm info object. */
00192 void psht_destroy_alm_info (psht_alm_info *info);
00193 
00194 /* \} */
00195 
00196 /*! \defgroup geominfogroup Functions for dealing with geometry information */
00197 /*! \{ */
00198 
00199 /*! Creates a geometry information from a set of ring descriptions.
00200     All arrays passed to this function must have \a nrings elements.
00201     \param nrings the number of rings in the map
00202     \param nph the number of pixels in each ring
00203     \param ofs the index of the first pixel in each ring in the map array
00204     \param stride the stride between consecutive pixels
00205     \param phi0 the azimuth (in radians) of the first pixel in each ring
00206     \param theta the colatitude (in radians) of each ring
00207     \param weight the pixel weight to be used for the ring
00208     \param geom_info will hold a pointer to the newly created data structure
00209  */
00210 void psht_make_geom_info (int nrings, const int *nph, const ptrdiff_t *ofs,
00211   const int *stride, const double *phi0, const double *theta,
00212   const double *weight, psht_geom_info **geom_info);
00213 
00214 /*! Deallocates the geometry information in \a info. */
00215 void psht_destroy_geom_info (psht_geom_info *info);
00216 
00217 /* \} */
00218 
00219 /*! \defgroup sjoblistgroup Functions for dealing with single precision job lists
00220 \note All pointers to maps or a_lm that are passed to the job-adding functions
00221 must not be de-allocated until after the last call of execute_jobs() for
00222 a particular job list! This is because PSHT does not copy the input data,
00223 but only stores the pointers to the supplied maps and a_lm.
00224  */
00225 /*! \{ */
00226 
00227 /*! Creates a new joblist object. */
00228 void pshts_make_joblist (pshts_joblist **joblist);
00229 /*! Removes all jobs in \a joblist. */
00230 void pshts_clear_joblist (pshts_joblist *joblist);
00231 /*! Deallocates the given joblist object. */
00232 void pshts_destroy_joblist (pshts_joblist *joblist);
00233 
00234 /*! Adds a new scalar alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a alm
00235     and writes data to \a map. If \a add_output is 0, \a map will be
00236     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a map. */
00237 void pshts_add_job_alm2map (pshts_joblist *joblist, const pshts_cmplx *alm,
00238   float *map, int add_output);
00239 /*! Adds a new scalar map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a map
00240     and writes data to \a alm. If \a add_output is 0, \a alm will be
00241     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a alm. */
00242 void pshts_add_job_map2alm (pshts_joblist *joblist, const float *map,
00243   pshts_cmplx *alm, int add_output);
00244 /*! Adds a new polarised alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00245     \a almT, \a almG and \a almC and writes data to \a mapT, \a mapQ and
00246     \a mapU. If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be
00247     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output maps. */
00248 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_pol (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00249   const pshts_cmplx *almT, const pshts_cmplx *almG, const pshts_cmplx *almC,
00250   float *mapT, float *mapQ, float *mapU, int add_output);
00251 /*! Adds a new polarised map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00252     \a mapT, \a mapQ and \a mapU and writes data to \a almT, \a almG and
00253     \a almC. If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be
00254     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output a_lm. */
00255 void pshts_add_job_map2alm_pol (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00256   const float *mapT, const float *mapQ, const float *mapU,
00257   pshts_cmplx *almT, pshts_cmplx *almG, pshts_cmplx *almC, int add_output);
00258 /*! Adds a new spin alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00259     \a alm1 and \a alm2 and writes data to \a map1 and map2.
00260     If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be overwritten, else the result
00261     will be added to the output maps. */
00262 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_spin (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00263   const pshts_cmplx *alm1, const pshts_cmplx *alm2, float *map1, float *map2,
00264   int spin, int add_output);
00265 /*! Adds a new spin map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00266     \a map1 and \a map2 and writes data to \a alm1 and \a alm2.
00267     If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be overwritten, else the result
00268     will be added to the output a_lm. */
00269 void pshts_add_job_map2alm_spin (pshts_joblist *joblist, const float *map1,
00270   const float *map2, pshts_cmplx *alm1, pshts_cmplx *alm2, int spin,
00271   int add_output);
00272 /*! Adds a new job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00273     \a alm and writes maps of the first derivatives to \a mapdtheta and
00274     \a mapdphi, respectively. If \a add_output is 0,
00275     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00276     to the output maps. */
00277 void pshts_add_job_alm2map_deriv1 (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00278   const pshts_cmplx *alm, float *mapdtheta, float *mapdphi, int add_output);
00279 
00280 /*! Executes the jobs in \a joblist, using \a geom_info as map geometry
00281     and \a alm_info as structure of the a_lm coefficients.
00282     \note The map geometry and the a_lm structure have to be supplied to this
00283     function only, since this information is not needed by PSHT anywhere else.
00284     However, it is the user's responsibility to ensure that the input arrays
00285     (specified by calls to the job-adding functions) are consistent with the
00286     specified geometry and a_lm structure, and that the output arrays are
00287     large enough to hold the produced results.
00288  */
00289 void pshts_execute_jobs (pshts_joblist *joblist,
00290   const psht_geom_info *geom_info, const psht_alm_info *alm_info);
00291 
00292 /* \} */
00293 
00294 /*! \defgroup djoblistgroup Functions for dealing with double precision job lists
00295 \note All pointers to maps or a_lm that are passed to the job-adding functions
00296 must not be de-allocated until after the last call of execute_jobs() for
00297 a particular job list! This is because PSHT does not copy the input data,
00298 but only stores the pointers to the supplied maps and a_lm.
00299 */
00300 /*! \{ */
00301 
00302 /*! Creates a new joblist object. */
00303 void pshtd_make_joblist (pshtd_joblist **joblist);
00304 /*! Removes all jobs in \a joblist. */
00305 void pshtd_clear_joblist (pshtd_joblist *joblist);
00306 /*! Deallocates the given joblist object. */
00307 void pshtd_destroy_joblist (pshtd_joblist *joblist);
00308 
00309 /*! Adds a new scalar alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a alm
00310     and writes data to \a map. If \a add_output is 0, \a map will be
00311     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a map. */
00312 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const pshtd_cmplx *alm,
00313   double *map, int add_output);
00314 /*! Adds a new scalar map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from \a map
00315     and writes data to \a alm. If \a add_output is 0, \a alm will be
00316     overwritten, else the result will be added to \a alm. */
00317 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const double *map,
00318   pshtd_cmplx *alm, int add_output);
00319 /*! Adds a new polarised alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00320     \a almT, \a almG and \a almC and writes data to \a mapT, \a mapQ and
00321     \a mapU. If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be
00322     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output maps. */
00323 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_pol (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00324   const pshtd_cmplx *almT, const pshtd_cmplx *almG, const pshtd_cmplx *almC,
00325   double *mapT, double *mapQ, double *mapU, int add_output);
00326 /*! Adds a new polarised map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00327     \a mapT, \a mapQ and \a mapU and writes data to \a almT, \a almG and
00328     \a almC. If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be
00329     overwritten, else the result will be added to the output a_lm. */
00330 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm_pol (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00331   const double *mapT, const double *mapQ, const double *mapU,
00332   pshtd_cmplx *almT, pshtd_cmplx *almG, pshtd_cmplx *almC, int add_output);
00333 /*! Adds a new spin alm2map job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00334     \a alm1 and \a alm2 and writes data to \a map1 and map2.
00335     If \a add_output is 0, the output maps will be overwritten, else the result
00336     will be added to the output maps. */
00337 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_spin (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00338   const pshtd_cmplx *alm1, const pshtd_cmplx *alm2, double *map1, double *map2,
00339   int spin, int add_output);
00340 /*! Adds a new spin map2alm job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00341     \a map1 and \a map2 and writes data to \a alm1 and \a alm2.
00342     If \a add_output is 0, the output a_lm will be overwritten, else the result
00343     will be added to the output a_lm. */
00344 void pshtd_add_job_map2alm_spin (pshtd_joblist *joblist, const double *map1,
00345   const double *map2, pshtd_cmplx *alm1, pshtd_cmplx *alm2, int spin,
00346   int add_output);
00347 /*! Adds a new job to \a joblist, which reads data from
00348     \a alm and writes maps of the first derivatives to \a mapdtheta and
00349     \a mapdphi, respectively. If \a add_output is 0,
00350     the output maps will be overwritten, else the result will be added
00351     to the output maps. */
00352 void pshtd_add_job_alm2map_deriv1 (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00353   const pshtd_cmplx *alm, double *mapdtheta, double *mapdphi, int add_output);
00354 
00355 /*! Executes the jobs in \a joblist, using \a geom_info as map geometry
00356     and \a alm_info as structure of the a_lm coefficients.
00357     \note The map geometry and the a_lm structure have to be supplied to this
00358     function only, since this information is not needed by PSHT anywhere else.
00359     However, it is the user's responsibility to ensure that the input arrays
00360     (specified by calls to the job-adding functions) are consistent with the
00361     specified geometry and a_lm structure, and that the output arrays are
00362     large enough to hold the produced results.
00363  */
00364 void pshtd_execute_jobs (pshtd_joblist *joblist,
00365   const psht_geom_info *geom_info, const psht_alm_info *alm_info);

00367 /* \} */
